ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have you been treated unfairly by strangers because you are an LGBTQ+ individual?
Notes: 1 = The event has never happened to you; 2 = The event happened once in a while (less than 10% of the time); 3 = The event happened sometimes (10-25% of the time); 4 = The event happened a lot (26-49% of the time); 5 = The event happened most of the time (50-70% of the time); 6 = The event happened almost all of the time (more than 70% of the time)

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have you been treated unfairly by people in service jobs (by store clerks, waiters, bartenders, waitresses, bank tellers, mechanics, and others) because you are an LGBTQ+ individual?
Notes: 1 = The event has never happened to you; 2 = The event happened once in a while (less than 10% of the time); 3 = The event happened sometimes (10-25% of the time); 4 = The event happened a lot (26-49% of the time); 5 = The event happened most of the time (50-70% of the time); 6 = The event happened almost all of the time (more than 70% of the time)

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have you been verbally insulted because you are an LGBTQ+ individual?
Notes: 1 = The event has never happened to you; 2 = The event happened once in a while (less than 10% of the time); 3 = The event happened sometimes (10-25% of the time); 4 = The event happened a lot (26-49% of the time); 5 = The event happened most of the time (50-70% of the time); 6 = The event happened almost all of the time (more than 70% of the time)

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have you been made fun of, picked on, pushed, shoved, hit, or threatened with harm because you are an LGBTQ+ individual?
Notes: 1 = The event has never happened to you; 2 = The event happened once in a while (less than 10% of the time); 3 = The event happened sometimes (10-25% of the time); 4 = The event happened a lot (26-49% of the time); 5 = The event happened most of the time (50-70% of the time); 6 = The event happened almost all of the time (more than 70% of the time)

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times have you been called heterosexist or transphobic names like dyke, lezzie, faggot, queer, or other names?
Notes: 1 = The event has never happened to you; 2 = The event happened once in a while (less than 10% of the time); 3 = The event happened sometimes (10-25% of the time); 4 = The event happened a lot (26-49% of the time); 5 = The event happened most of the time (50-70% of the time); 6 = The event happened almost all of the time (more than 70% of the time)

ElementDescription: In the past year, how many times were you denied a raise, a promotion, tenure, a good assignment, a job, or other such thing at work that you deserved because you are an LGBTQ+ individual?
